intro: Pabstiella seriata, commonly known as the seriated pabstiella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming during the spring and early summer. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, Pabstiella seriata is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
